I don't know whether they were completely incompetent or thieves. Either way, find somewhere else to take your equipment.

name: Tj Bell
text: Been trying to buy a new tractor for almost three months. Had to apply multiple times for loan approval. Was never told that only one company offered free loader until I was denied by the other two. Now my credit score has taken a big hit and still no tractor. This happens after I spent the last 4yrs getting my credit score to 700+. And had just paid off $100k in loans and mortgage. Could have gotten a kubota the next week but thought that I’d give these guys a shot. My mistake

resp.text: Mr. Bell, I want to start off by apologizing for the negative experience with our company. We strive to provide the best customer experience possible. We recognize errors were made on our part and will work to get these corrected for the future. It is reviews such as yours that provide our company the ability to learn from our mistakes and make improvements to our processes.

text: My company has purchased several brand new and used skid steers from Bobcat of Huntsville. We have had terrible service with them since one of the sales guy left. No one has helped get anything resolved. They have had a piece of our equipment for 3 months now to fix and havent even touched it. We have also had several parts sent to us that were wrong and have to ship back. Overall not happy with their service at all. David held this place together.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are pleased to announce that Bobcat of Huntsville has recently been purchased by Berry Companies, Inc. (www.berrycompaniesinc.com) and we are dedicated to making the investments in Huntsville that will bring it up to a level that is equal to our other Bobcat dealerships across the country. It will take some time but you will be seeing changes that will allow us to provide the level of support that a Bobcat customer deserves. We will be in contact with you shortly.

name: Ida Buttarazzi
text:
Let me tell you about Peter. He worked the Eden Condominium beach the entire week we were there. We arrived July 25th and departed August 1st.
This young man worked from sun up to sun down with a smile on his face and the beast demeanor towards his customers.
After a couple of days of meeting Peter, we learned  that he is a 16 year old guy from GA, that will be a senior in high school and is working the summer to save money.
He truly restored my faith in humanity and the younger generation, after experiencing a week of entitled, rude and condescending “adults” that have been obviously repressed by covid.

name: Lisa Andre
text: Our beach chair guy was top notch. However we paid 450.00 for beach chairs. They allowed personal tents and chairs in front of the chairs. It completely blocked a passage to the beach. We requested to be in front of those chairs, we were told they couldn’t move the chairs out of line. It is unreasonable to charge 450.00 when you don’t enforce the rules. I have emailed and no one has responded. I want others to know before wasting their money. Very unpleased with company.

name: The Brannens
text: What a true gem VINNY was during our stay at Sea Spray April 3-10, 2021.  A true gentleman, polite and a ray of sunshine.  He greeted us by our names Mr. & Mrs every day.  He has such a wonderful smile & cheerful disposition.  Just as the sun would move, he was right there to readjust our umbrella to keep us in the shade.  He really put our beach experience over the top.

text: Frankie Campisisi provided extraordinary services.

text: We stayed at Eden the week of April 3-10th 2021 and we had the best week thanks to Vinny! He was always so helpful and friendly. He's a kind young man and you should be proud to have him as part of your staff! He was always checking in on us to make sure we were comfortable! Thank you so much Vinny!

text: Our experience this yr doesn't really even rate a 1. We stayed from the 26th thru the 30th. Got there late afternoon on the 26th. Went out to the attendant and he got mad because I wanted to rent chairs for the next three days. He wanted me to wait till the next morning. I wanted to go ahead and rent them so I'd have them there when we got out there. He was VERY VERY  rude and condescending.  Just ugly. I apologized for bothering him. The next morning or so I heard a lady letting him have it for the same treatment. We have always had good service every yr we have been to royal palms until this yr. I wish I knew the guys name but he was older with long blonde hair. He needs to be FIRED.

name: Robert Culp
text:
Came in on September 10 and stayed at BW The Tides. Rented chairs on the 11th and 12th. Jonas took great care of us Friday and Julia took great care of us on Saturday! Julia went above and beyond since those of us renting chairs wanted our umbrellas moved several times. She did it without a complaint and really made the day that much more enjoyable. She was awesome!! You have a great company with great people there at PBS! Y’all stay safe with Sally coming in!

Robbie

name: Julie Bourque
text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Orange Beach this week. Kaia was FANTASTIC!  Always greeted us with a smile and eager to help in any way. We really enjoyed chatting with her. Looking forward to seeing her again in the future. Julie & Kirk

name: Noelle Nicholls
text: We stayed at Sleep Inn on the Beach in Orange Beach and rented lounge chairs and an umbrella.  I'm giving them 2 stars only because their service people were so nice.  Unlike other services in this area, they do not take debit or credit cards, and you cannot charge to your room (cash or check only).  This is really inconvenient, as I don't generally take my checkbook or much cash to the beach.  We arrived about two hours before they closed on our first day at the beach and asked for a quote for the next two full days and for the two hours remaining on that day.  The service person quoted an almost entire day's fee for just two hours, which I did not take (although I did book the two full days).  It seemed odd to me that they would rather let it sit there set up and unused rather than make some money on it.  Also, they did not have enough service people to handle the work.  Our chairs/umbrella were never set up before 8:15 AM and we had to do almost all of the repositioning of the umbrella ourselves because their personnel were just not around.  We also lost the last three hours on our last day--Orange Beach had light rain but because there had been a lightning strike in Foley, they said they were not allowed to have umbrellas up.  We were not offered a refund.  We plan to go back to the Sleep Inn next year, but I'm seriously thinking of purchasing our own chairs and umbrella rather than deal with this again.

name: Shelley Moore
text: Reasonable prices and great service.  Chandler and Hugh were great.  We came down one afternoon just before 5 and Chandler ran over and offered to bring our umbrella out! I said no, but that is great service!!  She asked several times during our stay if she could adjust our umbrella.

text: Rented chairs for two days... we got really burned the first day. So thought they would be understanding and would let us use chairs another day. Nope they said the could not rent our chairs cause we had reserved them. That’s crazy they were not overly booked there were plenty other chairs to be rented. So people beware!!  Only rent a day at a time. The chick on the phone was rude and could careless!!! They did not lose any money and I was gonna rent again but instead they lost more money. Movie timer service the hotel was even shocked they did not work with us..

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Furgason,
We certainly apologize for the service you received. Please allow us to make this right. Please call us in the office at 251-981-4807.

Always seem to show up at exactly the right time to move our umbrella to keep us out of the sun...Very very appreciative to him for contributing to our great  vacation.

text: I called this company, mistakenly, about a problem I was having with beach chair rentals.  The owner was absolutely amazing and I will be using this company going forward for all of my trips (3-4) a year.  Owner cares about his business and the customers he serves.

text: This was our first trip to Orange Beach and we had the pleasure of utilizing Perdido Beach Sevices. Katie took amazing care of myself and my husband! I highly recommend!! And if you stay at the Holiday Inn Express tell Katie hi!

name: Jimmy Grantham
text:
I reserved 36 seat on the Perdido Beach Service's "Wild Heart" Fireworks Cruise for my family and clients on Saturday night, July 2nd. All of my guest had an absolutely GREAT TIME! The crusie & fireworks show was the very best I have ever seen and we had the Best seats in house. The staff was so accommodating and the food was wonderful. My customers and clients said they all had a great time. So much so that we plan to make this an annual event.
I think you might consider getting another boat in the future, because the secret is out. Cruise with the "Wild Heart" and you'll have an experience like no other. Great Job, Guy! See you next year.

name: Kelly Johnson
text: Perido Beach Service , is no service anymore. I"ve rented an umbrella and chair for 7 years.  They used to come by and adjust your umbrella.  Now they tell you they have the whole beach to work and you never see them again. Today took the cake...I came down late because we went on a Dauphin Cruise and they had taken my umbrella and cushions I rented. When I asked for them to put out they would not, nor would they refund the day. I guess I'll be buying an umbrella and chairs for next year,  Good Bye Perdido Beach Service.

name: Andrew McCartney
text: Scheduled a reservation on 8/28/19 for a mini-excavator to be delivered on 9/5/19. I was told that the machine would be delivered between 8-9 am. Machine was never delivered. Finally called at 930am and was initially told the machine had not come back from a previous rental, but that it was due back and they would call. Never received a call back. Stopped by the shop around 1pm and was told that the machine still hadn't been returned, but again, that they would call. I called back at 4pm and was told that the machine had been rented out for a week. Apparently it does no good to make a reservation with this company,  and I wasted an entire day dealing with this, a day that I had taken as leave from work. They did offer to refund the cost of the reservation, I'm still waiting to see if the refund comes thru.  I would not recommend doing business with this company.

name: Teresa Alexander
text: Worst experience ever!  My husband went in and got an estimate to rent a backhoe but was talked into a dozer.  The quote was for $2400.  So, he sent me the next week to rent it and at that time the price went up to $2800.  So, my husband took off work to use it On A Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday & Monday.  But, they didn’t bring it out until 2:00 pm on Thursday when it was supposed to be there early that morning.  He called and they give him the run around.  So, when he finished with it, he called them to come and get it and left it on 3/4 of a tank of fuel.  So after two weeks they finally came to get it and charged us over $2900.  The guy told my husband that the extra was for fuel when he left it with more fuel than it had to begin with which was a half tank.  The guy that brought it out, dropped it off and handed him a paper to sign.  So apparently that paper said that it had a full tank but my husband didn’t get time to confirm it.  So their response was sir you signed the paper.  All I can say is crooked!  We will not do business with them again.  Also, if we had gotten the backhoe we could have did what we needed to do but was talked out of it.

resp.text: Mrs. Alexander, we were sorry to hear about your recent experience at our rental store location in Huntsville. We informed the rental manager immediately upon learning about your experience and hearing your concerns. Our rental store manager reached out to your husband recently to talk to him and help make things right. We hope that is the first step in many to earning your trust and business back. If we can do anything else please don’t hesitate to reach out.

So I approved the job, they ran and got the injector and within 2 hours from start to finish, Truck was fixed and I picked up my next load and never missed a beat thanks to these guys. name: Tony Bass
text: I bought a tractor here a year ago because they are the closest Kubota dealer to where I live. I could have gotten a MUCH better deal from another dealer but I didn't want to drive over an hour if I needed parts. For this reason I was willing to overlook the salesman who had ZERO knowledge of tractors, had no idea what a flail mower was and couldn't tell me what features would justify the expense of one implement over the other. I was willing to ignore  the random mechanic who wandered onto the sales floor trying to talk me out of the machine I wanted even though he had no understanding of my needs. I also endured the pain of dealing with the rude and unwelcoming finance manager who had the personality of a shoe. All of this because of the promise of a good service department and the full coverage warranty through Kubota and KTAC which is supposed to cover EVERYTHING on the tractor. Fast forward a few months and it's time for a small part that broke. I went right to HMTC service dept only to find out that not only is the part not covered, but they don't even have the part in stock and will take a month to come in. Ok, chalk it up to bad luck. Another month or so later I head to HMTC again for simple parts and they have none in stock. This happened a total of 4 times and I finally give up. The management here is out of touch with the market and their customers. They refuse to hire competent, qualified employees. Even the lady and the front door acts like you're interrupting her day when you walk through the door. Never again will I do business with or recommend anyone to HMTC. I honestly hope they get bought out soon by someone who knows how to run a business and serve their customers.

text: I think I might have called at a bad time. The woman who answered sounded unhappy I had called and was a bit brusque. My only experience with them was this one phone call.

resp.text:
Our apologise this is a small home based side business with 4 inflatables. We have 2 children so getting a peaceful, quiet environment to answer business phone calls can be challenging.  It goes to our cell phone so we could literally be at a store shopping, giving the kids a bath, in the middle of Chuck-e-Cheese... who knows! Given that our preferred method of communication is online (facebook messanger, email, text, etc. etc.), but we still answer all calls as best we can given circumstances.

We also get upwards of 4 to 5 calls a day wanting prices and descriptions, in the past we've spent 10+ minutes discussing ever facet of our bounce houses with a single customer, their all excited and ready to pull the trigger, only to find out they need one tomorrow and nothing is available. To avoid wasting everyone's time we steer the conversation to date first, if your flexible on dates or are doing homework for an event 6 months in advance we'd be happy to discuss all our inflatsables. Pricing, pictures, and descriptions are also all laid out online at www.bouncehouseal.com/pricing.

name: Huntsville Chem-Dry
text: I chose this place over others I called mainly because I could rent a trailer and a skid steer for a half day on a Saturday for around $160. Know one could beat that price and didn't have to provide a credit card over the phone to hold, just needed my name. They also called the day before to confirm the rental. Check out for the machine was easy and it worked great to spread 14 tons of gravel. Returned the machine a few minutes before 12pm and was not rushed or felt like they were waiting for me to return especially on a weekend. it looks like they had a lot of equipment to rent so i imagine i will return at some point.

resp.text: Since this review we have worked with Chem-Dry on several occasions.  We 100% will leave our doors open until all customers are out the door, and our staff are trained to never rush a customer when they are here.   It is good to hear that our guys are doing their jobs as they are trained.  Thank you again for the kind review and we look forward to working with you in the future.

name: Nicholas Forrester
text: I was down there renting a piece of equipment from there and the older guy at the counter was nice and polite but the young guy working on the counter was rude and used  dirty  language I have never felt so disrespected in my life that will be the last time I use them and I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone cause robin rents has a lot better customer service and they would never treat anyone like they treated me

resp.text:
Just figured out who this is, Nickolas Forrester (goes by Nick) came to pickup from our store a piece of equipment for another contractor.  Nick was on the wrong side of the counter leaning against our cash drawer while we were in a rush.  Nobody "used dirty language" towards him, we asked him to move to the other side of the counter where the customers stand and Nick blew up on us.  We asked him to please leave the store if he could not act appropriately.  He then went outside to get loaded and started cursing at the guys on the yard.  We have several witnesses, including customers that we in the store during the exchange.  The contractor he was working for has been notified and Mr Nick is no longer allowed to come into our store.
We do not allow customers to verbally abuse our employees who are just doing their jobs and do not put up with it, period.  We are a family owned, christian business.

name: Zane Slocumb
text: The 50' lift I rented had not been well maintained and/or inspected before was rented to me. The electric motor had only a 6 hour charge on it at the time of rental, the gasoline engine would not start, and two bolts to secure part of the boom that is NOT supposed to slide were missing which lead to other problems that required some improvisation and resulted in the task taking much longer than it would have if everything had been in working order. I showed and explained the problems to their personnel, but no offer for any discount was made, apparently because I was still able to get the done over the weekend. I returned the lift with a full charge and my improvisation still in place so they could see what I did.

resp.text:
Let us begin by expressing how sorry we are that you had issues with the 50' tow behind lift that you had rented.  I would like to address the 6 hour run time on the lift.  With those lifts, that is very standard run time before the lift needs to be recharged.  Our counter sales reps should of made you aware of this at the beginning of the rental, and if there was no communication by our staff on that then you have my full apologies, and that will be addressed internally.  The engine is not meant to run the machine, but to charge the batteries when no power is available.  We have since fixed the engine to make sure we offer that additional feature.
We strive to be the premier equipment rental company in Huntsville and really thank you for your review.  The other issues raised are being addressed internally as well to make sure we are putting quality products out to the general public for rental.   We hope to see you again in the future!!

text:
Needing to rent a skid steer and just got back in town so i googled rentals but forgot about this place but not sure why or how cause they are the best in town. Its been a while since I've  been here but i remember the last mini skid steer i rented popped a track while an hour away in Tennesee . I was able to fix myself and save them a trip but the people were  awesome and gave me an extra day and i also believe i was given an extra day  because of the rain. Oh, and i was late getting it back with no extra charge. Not saying its okay to be late returning here but that was pretty awesome.
The main reason i originally  came to you guys was because everyone else wanted a insane deposit on top of higher prices than you guys. Not sure if that policy is still the same but I will find out tomorrow i guess. Coming down to rent a skid steer and dump trailer if you guys have one. Sorry for the 18 page review of rambling thats also about 2 years late but you guys are truly the best in town. Little things like the track incident go a long way and made me a customer for life. Thanks again for truly making customers feel like they arent grabbing ankles when they walk through the door.
I Dont think I'm  allowed to mention other companies but.... we'll say rhymes with Bobin Rents. I made that mistake once. Dont waste your time folks unless you want to spend double. Im cheap so Ive called and checked everywhere and I'll save you the steps cause you can't beat Valley Rental on any level.

resp.text: Thanks Ricky for this review.  We appreciate you taking the time and its nice to see our hard work gets noticed.

name: Holly Lapointe Jordan
text: Good equipment - very reasonable rental rates.  And they prooved to be incredibly fair when there was equipment failure on job site; they sent mechanic to the site to access the situation and provide service on site - and the problem turned out to be big issue; so... managemnt gave me the next size up for the rest of that day and the next morning - FOR NO EXTRA MONEY.  This type of business will ensure a Long & Loyal Relationship.  I have not seen this type of management style in a while - it is a pleasant surprise!

name: Bryan Carmean
text:
I have rented on 3 separate occasions from Valley Rental & up till today I could have honestly provided 5 stars. I was always treated with great personalities and their equipment is adequate  with great rates. However, after today I can honestly say I will never rent with them again and would advise other DIY’ers to steer clear. The issue is that there is no way to hold the company accountable if there's an issue. Unlike Robin Rents, United Rentals, etc the buck stops at valley so if the owner disagrees with your personality then you lose.
I rented a small mini backhoe to do some yard work for a 4 hour overnight rental with the intention of possibly keeping it for the weekend. Unfortunately the equipment was rented out  with no working brakes outside of the hydro static system itself. With that being said while attempting to switch from low to high gear the tractor got stuck in neutral and began to run away out of control an was unable to reduce the speed due to a complete absence of a manual functioning brake. This quickly escalated into a very bad situation which forced me to dive the back hoe bucket into my asphalt driveway (scoring It indefinitely) in order to prevent a potential disaster on a 3k plus lb. piece of equipment.
Needless to say I am not one to complain which is where I messed up. I received a call this afternoon from Ross who asked why the tractor was not returned @ 0900. This immediately infuriated me as I had explained the day before I would likely be keeping it for the weekend. The situation got completely out of control after explaining the incident that had occurred with the faulty tractor. To be fair he was prompt on offering a mechanic to come look at the unit but protested my explanation of the brake system and pointed blame. To make matters worse they literally had to call the local Kubota dealer to verify the brake system characteristics. I found this out by calling Kubota myself to verify this myself and was informed by Kubota that Valley Rental had them. After this I decided I wanted nothing more to do with their equipment and lies and called to have them just pick up the tractor and be done with it. Upon contact another argument took place with myself and Ross which led to Ross cursing and using profanity at me and hanging up the phone after stating he was sending someone to get his tractor. At this point I have no idea what I am even being charged and no one I can talk to verify how to resolve this issue as the GM himself will just hang up on you. All in all I find it very frustrating that there is no way to hold Valley Rentals accountable for their actions. The problem is at the top and not the solution like larger rental facilities that you can hold accountable. They did by no request of myself refund a portion of my rental (1 hour of use and 3 ½ gallons of fuel to be exact). They did not even offer to repair the driveway and Ross never apologized for his professionalism & disrespect & I of all people know professionalism being a 10 year disabled combat Vet. Honestly, the majority of Valley Rental is spot on. But with situations like these customers can be taken advantage of and have no avenues of recourse. All in all I say rent at your own discretion and hopefully nothing goes wrong because if it does your on your own. Otherwise be smart and rent only from organizations that can and will hold themselves accountable for their mistakes and lack of communication.
I assume they will rebuttal against this review, possibly even with an apology from Ross. However, if the GM wanted to correct the issue it would have been done prior to me posting this review and in a timely manner. At this point an apologize given due to a public review is nothing more than an attempt to discredit the review and salvage other/ new  customer relationships that may be harmed by my sharing of a real world experience in order to prevent others from experiencing similar stressful & unsafe situations

resp.text:
Mr. Carmean, we are very sorry you feel the way you do. We believe the entire situation could have been avoided with better, calmer communication.
On May 11th, Mr. Carmean rented a mini backhoe.  He had informed the counter that he was paying for a half day/overnight rental and that he might extend out to a day to 2 days.  His rental expired at a half day at 8am and, as a company policy, we reached out to see how long he wanted to extend. This communication upset Mr. Carmean, to an unreasonable degree.
At that point, he informed us of the situation that occurred with the brakes of the mini backhoe.  As he described his situation the first conclusion, based on the information given, the machine was put into neutral and gathered speed going down a driveway and the parking brake system, which is used to hold the machine in place, not stop it when going that speed, did not stop the customer.  We then stated that we wanted to check the machine and wanted to send a mechanic out to make sure the machine was safe to use, per company policy.  We simply wanted our experienced mechanic to inspect the machine and determine what was going on.  These are hydrostatic machines and are not meant to go downhill in neutral, taking the machine out of the hydrostatic operating system and forcing it into neutral, to gain speed, can cause harm to the machine, and most importantly, the operator.
With the situation and Mr. Carmean, calmed down, our mechanic in route, the customer called the local Kubota dealership and asked if Kubota machines had brakes. Without knowing what machine the customer was referring to, the situation that occurred, etc.  they answered with a general statement of, “Yes, Kubota machines have brakes.”  The customer then called us back and was irate again calling everyone liars.   We were informed, by our Kubota dealer, when Kubota tried to reach out to him again, from someone actually in service, not just someone answering the phone, that Mr. Carmean would not let the Kubota Service manager get a word in and continued to verbally abuse him as well.
It is our company policy to educate our customers on the use of a machine before we allow them to leave our store with it. On the back side of our rental agreement, we address the inspection of the equipment, use of the equipment and the customer’s responsibility in an of emergency or equipment malfunction. Mr Carmean agreed to and signed this contract. Despite the fact, he did not follow our guidelines regarding the proper usage of the machine or the guidelines when an accident occurred, we did not charge him any extra and actually refunded him for the time he did not use.
While we don’t like to have unhappy customers, as we base our business on customer service, we also won’t allow customers to verbally abuse our staff.

text: Incorrect Delivery of lift, made an appointment to change the lift.  Guy said 1 pm in a separate conversation told my manager 1pm.  Called at 145 he said it was delivered.  Went out back, not there.  Called and they told me 15 minutes that was 25 minutes ago.  Still waiting.

name: Joshua Casey
text: These guys are always on point with my business equipment rentals. I call in with what i need and they make sure it's available and ready when i there. Whenever I've had an equipment issue they've always been quick to have a tech out to handle the issue.

name: Andrew Christopher
text: Very friendly and helpful staff! By far the best location in the company. The equipment is always in working order and new! My go-to for any landscaping project!

resp.text:
Hello Andrew,
Thank you for the positive feedback! We love to hear from happy customers. We look forward to working with you in the future.
Thank you,
Sunbelt Rentals

name: Sean Mendoza
text: Amazing! Had a couple issues with other rental companies. Decided to try Sunbelt. FANTASTIC customer service, knew their stuff and really got me going in the right direction. Much better pricing and the equipment worked wonderfully.

text: Good people, wide range of rental equipment and reasonable prices. I highly recommend.

text: Whatever equipment you need this is the store to go to, these guys will take care of you,  help make you money and save time. Every. Single. Time! Thanks Matt & Robbie

name: Steve Johnson
text: Their website had a bobcat rental listed at $220.00 for a day. I went to the Pelham office and the guy didn't really want to give me the time of day. I asked about renting a bobcat he said it would be $375.00 for a day. Plus $85.00 delivery each way. The delivery was in Pelham, very close by. I guess they have enough business that they really don't need walk in business.

name: Peter Stevens
text: Great customer service and competitive pricing! Will definitely be back!

name: Mary Beasley
text: Great customer service!  These guys are awesome!

name: Bill Williams
text: by far best location in Alabama.

name: The Eclectic Mama creator
text: Always helpful , even when there busy. They always try to get everything done for you even if it's short notice. Like I came by to just ask for some help , I got this one guy who was able to help load my vehicle and answered all my questions , but then this other customer comes in and interrupted us. But the sunbelt guy asked the customer to hold on so he could finish with me. I really like that they give each customer individual attention as much as they can before they get to the next person, it made me feel important. And it's one of the best things I loved about this company. Thanks sunbelt for putting me first when I need help and have questions.

name: Chaz Phil
text:
Reservation/rental process easy and went well. Price was $30.00 more than competitor's I used a week earlier. Office staff professional and knowledgeable. Rental was two man post hole digger/auger

Interaction with warehouse staff upon return did not go well and is reason for rating and review. Price is a small impacting factor, but I would avoid having to interact with the warehouse personnel so much as possible during the return process. If you cannot locate anyone for help during drop off- just drop it off where you can and head for the office to close your ticket out.

name: Ben Kuykendall
text: Let me start by saying that I will never go to another rental place after my recent experience here.  They have excellent customer service and, in my case, a flexible return policy if something goes wrong and you're not able to use the equipment.  They will work with you here and not try to stick it to you - at least that was my experience.

name: Matt Meter
text: Love working here!

name: Donna Farrar
text: I rented a lawn mower. Customer came in with the same question, Why does your website say that you have a 4 hour rental for half price? He tells him no, but the thing to do was to adjust the invoice since he came back so quickly. We can see that you're building a ticket to improve daily sales. Then they concentrated on me. Told me to pull around, never saw him again. Finally some one comes with a dirty lawn mower to put in my vehicle. Of course, the contract stipulates that I need to return it clean. The guy that loaded it asked me if I had something to tie it down. Of course this will be my last transaction with them Poor customer service And Greed will do it every time..

name: J Brown
text:
Dozier brought to job site w leaking hydraulic fluid n rt track popping and flapping in need of a new sprocket we were told.  Another hydraulic line broke again 2 days later. The clacking got worse n louder.  The Dozier became harder to turn causing a slow down in work, additional time, labor hours, fuel, and double use of excavator to do Dozier work.  Finally, Dozier operator could not take the clanging noise nor fighting to barely turn Dozier and walked off the job Sun May 23, 2021 after struggling w Dozier for 5 days w no repair or replacement of it.
Also rental excavator started leaking hydraulic fluid at bucket on Sunday May 23, 2021 causing a shut down of operations.  Contacted United and 7:30 am.  No one responded till mid afternoon to replace hose. A couple of hours later hydraulic fluid leaking from same spot.  Called again around 4:30 pm.  Reluctantly, service man came back out.  It was discovered that he had not tightened the hose that he installed.  Hence the 2nd leak.

resp.text: Thanks, J. We have escalated to the local management team and hope to resolve the issue with you quickly. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to help in the meantime.

text: The people are very professional and they always have the best and Updated equipment. Clean and reliable.

resp.text: Thanks, Garry. We appreciate the positive feedback and shout-out for our team. We look forward to working with you again next time.

text: Rent somewhere else!  They bragged about their equipment being better that others and theirs still  messed up. Man lift Would periodically stop working in rotation. Caused a huge delay in the job.  Returned  back, explained the problem  and they did a 1 minute test... How thorough can you be in thaybtime frame.  They said it's working fine. Didnt put a man in the basket, didn't raise it up and check much at all. A joke.  Waste of 380. Going to Sunbelt to get a decent piece of equipment. But hey at least they said thank you.

name: Gary Kendrick
text:
MidSouth rentals excels in service, price, equipment offered and upkeep of that equipment.  When you rent from them they provide you with equipment that has been cleaned and inspected so there are no surprises awaiting you, the next user and that is a comfort as well as getting your money's worth.

MidSouth rentals owners and management treat you like family and take care of you before, during and after the rental experience.  I personally don't rent from anyone else.

name: Regina Gamel
text: Very friendly and nice.

name: Dale Robinson
text: I have rented equipment from Midsouth Rentals in Florence once and was involved with two other rentals that my brother was doing. I can't say enough good about the staff and equipment that we received. They went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The manager delivered our rental unit and came to pick it up. We weren't quite done with it when he arrived so he jumped in and helped us for over an hour until we finished the job. You can't ask for better customer service. And the equipment is all brand new and in perfect condition. If you need to rent anything in the way of tools or equipment, this is the place to go! You won't be sorry! Thanks so much!

text: I rented a trenching maching to dig a 28 inch trench for a waterline. They delivered on time and gave me plenty of time to do the job.  I was surprised that they trusted a woman to operate their equipment. I had never used one before, but growing up on a farm, and still there going strong, I never put limitations on my abilities. It is just equipment that comes with instructions.  The only thing that does not come with instructions are humans or babies.

So small businesses who aren't from the area don't do business here they will refuse to rent if a local calls in after you verified a price of equipment is available and you are on your way to get it.
